intro: Bellucia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved bellucia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
